page.title: 01East of Windsor
page.content: Man made water areas are the predominant features of this block comprising, two reservoirs (The Queen Mother at Datchet and the Wraysbury Reservoir) and the irregularly shaped lakes remaining after gravel extraction. The Queen Mother Reservoir and the gravel lakes now provide leisure activities in the form of sailing and fishing. Scattered between water areas is the remnant of the farmland which used to predominate, the farming inhabitants having now largely given way to a commuting population in the villages of Wraysbury, Horton and Stanwell Moor. A commercial/industrial trading estate has been , and continues to be developed in Poyle, situated as it is so conveniently close to Junction 14 of Londons new orbital motorway,
